task_summary: Place the white box down on the table surface. If the robot is not already holding it, grasp it first, then move to the placement area, set it gently on the table, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows multiple small objects (red cylinder, orange bottle, green bottle, blue bottle, and a translucent/white box) with a 6-DOF arm above. The instruction is to put down the white box. The behavior first ensures the box is in the gripper, attempting a simple top grasp if needed. The robot then moves above the designated table placement area, places the box with low force, opens the gripper to release, and retreats to clear the scene.
preconditions: Robot and table are clear of obstacles along approach path
White box visible or its pose can be detected
Gripper operational and capable of top grasp
Table is a valid placement area
stepwise_plan: If not already holding the box, open gripper, detect the white box, compute a top grasp, execute grasp, and verify stability.
Move to a safe height above the placement zone on the table.
Place the box onto the table with gentle force and correct yaw.
Open gripper to release the box.
success_criteria: White box is released and resting stably on the table
No other objects are toppled or displaced beyond tolerance
Arm ends in a safe, collision-free pose away from the objects
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: re-detect the object and recompute grasp
Grasp instability: reattempt grasp with the same top strategy
Placement contact not detected: lower further or retry placement
Obstruction during transfer: adjust approach and replan move-above
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the box is released on the table and the arm has retreated by the specified distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear lowering/alignment toward the placement area is visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Expect contact with table and opening of the gripper.

node_specs.description: Checks if the white box is already held.
Open gripper to a safe width.
Detect pose of the white box.
Plan a top grasp and store it in blackboard.
Move above the placement zone at safe height.
Place the white box on the table with gentle force.
Back away from the placed object.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion or glare
Insufficient opening leading to partial release
recovery_strategy: Re-detect and recompute grasp; adjust top grasp approach
If unstable, re-open, re-grasp, and verify stability again
Adjust move-above pose and retry placement with gentle force
Open gripper wider and retry release
assumptions: The 'white box' corresponds to the translucent/white small box visible near the right side of the row of items.
Robot may or may not start holding the box; the tree handles both by checking and optionally grasping first.
Placement area is the table surface directly in front of the robot.

expected_success_criteria: Box ends upright and stationary on the table
No collisions with neighboring objects during placement
Robot retreats to a safe standoff pose
